result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant phoned re: warrant. She stated she missed her appearance due to medical issues. Per Judge - if defendant can provide medical documentation, the Court will look at cancelling the warrant. Fax number was provided for the defendant to give to her medical provider.

Second appearance on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant called to say she missed her court date due to being in the hospital. I informed her that a warrant was issued and the court would want documentation provided stating she was in the hospital before the warrant would be canceled. Defendant will fax the documents to our office. Defendant ti appear in court on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Address and phone number on file are correct.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:58 AM Defendant JULIE L ROBERTS in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
